intro: Ciliaria cinerascens, commonly known as the ash-gray ciliaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, pale green leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
